group_1.textLeft: ...But y'know,
if we wanna keep that world from bein'@connected to here,
won't it hafta be destroyed?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...
And since the system itself evolves autonomously,
it's impossible for me to create an exact@replica of that world.

group_1.textLeft: So if it breaks, that's that.
But that's even worse!

group_1.textRight: I know.
But how about we avoid doing it altogether?@'Cause I know a better way.

group_1.textLeft: What are you going to do...?

group_1.textRight: We're going to make it so that it's effectively@impossible to interfere with our side.

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean by "effectively"...?

group_1.textRight: Ui, you didn't want that world to be able to@interfere with this side,
and you didn't want the girls living there to know@the truth,
but you wanted to leave behind hope...
In other words, you wanted to leave behind "possibility", right?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah...!

group_1.textRight: Then we should do it like this.

group_1.textLeft: ...What're we going to do?

group_1.textRight: We'll change the laws of that world.
To put it simply...
Just like the speed of light and Planck's constant in@our universe,
there are fixed constants in that world that I can change.

group_1.textLeft: When Touka puts things simply, she makes it even harder to understand...
What happens when you change the numbers?

group_1.textRight: In order to cross the door linking the two worlds@and interfere with this world,
it'll take orders of magnitude more energy than before...
I'll modify it that way!

group_1.textLeft: Ahh, so theoretically, it's possible,
but actually doing it is practically impossible!@Something like that?

group_1.textRight: It's just like that!
If I change it so that it requires nearly infinite@energy,
then even for as long they're alive,
they'll find that they can't collect that amount by@any means.
Even AIs would give up!

group_1.textLeft: Is changing the constants really okay?

group_1.textRight: I'm the one adjusting the numbers, so there's no@need to worry!
It won't break the world that's already in place.
What do you think of my idea?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, thank you! I want to go with that idea!
The wishes they want fulfilled might never come@true...
But I'm really glad they still have "hope" left!

group_1.textRight: You're so kind, Ui~!
Weeell, I'll go and apply the new settings right away.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah!
It's all up to you!
We're countin' on ya!

group_1.textRight: If there is a god,
I wonder if they had similar worries.

group_1.textLeft: I think that was a good answer, though!
Our other selves' wishes being granted...
...is pretty much impossible now...

group_1.textRight: But it ain't like that world doesn't have hope!
...I wonder what the Tsuruno and others in@that world are going to do now?

group_1.textLeft: At first, they'll try no matter how hard the@challenge is,
but they'll probably give up when they realize it's impossible...?

group_1.textRight: Ya think they'll back down that easily?@OUR other selves...?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm, I guess not...
But she said it would take almost infinite energy...

group_1.textRight: I hope...they won't be too reckless...

group_1.textCenter: I don't think it's likely that they will break through,@but...
It's a genius's job to be prepared for the@unexpected!
Now then, your little vacation's about to end...
The time that was stopped will begin to move~
I'm...gonna go home and rest up...
